Normally it's posted with the title info so I'll but it here from btarena:

-Unpack
-Burn or mount
-Install in your prefered language ENG/PL/RU
-Apply all the updates from DVD2 according to their incremental versions
-Copy the contents of the same language folder, as you
previously chose, that is found within the ViTALiTY
folder on DVD2 to your installed game dir
-Start the game with acess.exe or use the launcher
to configure game settings first

@ El Noodle,

No dude, I know that. I always check with Virus Total and note that normally the false positives have a "usual suspects" list. However Avira is almost never a false positive with the good crackers - Avira knows normally when it's a game crack and when it's a real virus etc. This is the first time Avira gave me a positive since I Dled some video editing stuff that had a real virus. That's all. Well....one other time it happened and a Avira update took it off it's list about a week later. This has not happened yet with this program. That's why I posted.

@ Amaximus

Iight, anyway u might wanna change your virus scanner anyway, so it looks like it did what it should do for the first time ;p
